calendar.p: The Julian calendar, as used in England before 1752. The year starts on March 25.

A Hebrew calendar dating from the creation of the world, based on biblical genealogy. The start date varies according to the biblical texts used. Here, based on the dates given for the same events in other formats, this calendar starts in 3962 BC.
A calendar dating from the Roman discovery of Britain. Based on the dates given for the same events in other formats, this calendar starts in 50 BC.

zone.heading:
The proportion of the ffunerall hearse of
Edmonde Bridges Lord: Chandos Knighte of
the most honorable in the Chappell of the Castle
of Sudeleye in Comitatu: Glowcestrense the .. daye
of ... Anno :RR: Elizabethe. xliito

The Office of a Kinge of Armes
with his Authority within his province.
Notice & keping of Recordes ffirst, as nighe as he can he shall take knowledge and keepe
Recorde of the Armes, Creastes, Cognisances and Auncieant
vsed woordes: As also of the Lyne Discente or pedegre
of euery Gentillman within his province of what estate
or degree soeuer he be./
Notice of foundacions of Churches. &c. Item he shall enter into all Churches Chappells Oratories
Castles howses or Auncient buildinges to take knowledge
of theire ffoundacions, & of the noble Estates buried in them
as also of thiere Armes & Armes of the places theire head
and their Ancient Records./
false Armes. Item he shall prohibite any Gentillman to beare the Armes
of another or suche as be not trewe Armory, & as he ought
accordinge to the Lawe of Armes .//
Marchantes marke Item he shall prohibite any Marchante notary or other, to
put theyre names markes or deuises within Escocheons
or Shieldes which pertayne to Gentillmen only bearinge Armes
& to none other ./
Armes borne without authority Itm he shall make diligent searche if any beare Armes
without Authoritye or good righte, & fyndinge suche although
they be trewe Armorye, he shall prohibite them.
Graunting of Confirmations: of Armes. Creastes &cItem thesaide kinge of Armes in his province hathe fullpower &
authoritye by the kinges graunte & by vertue of his Office to geve
confirmations to all noblemen & Gentillmen ignorante of theire
Armes or Creastes: for which he ought to have the ffee belonginge
thervnto./
Geving Armes Item he hathe authority to geve Armes & Creastes to persons of
habilitye deservinge well of the Prynce & Common weale, by
reason of Office, Authority, Wisdome, Learninge good maner
& sober governement./ They to have suche graunted by
patent vnder the seale of Office of thesaide kinge of Armes
& to paye therfore the ffees accustomed.
None may erecte Standardes Banners Coate Armour. &c Item no Gentillman or others may erect & set vp in any churche
at any funeralles, either Banners, Standardes or Coates
of Armes, helmes, Creastes, or Sworde, or any other hatchment
without the licence of thesaide kinge of Armes of the province
Or by the allowance of his marshall or deputy./ Because
the Armes of the noble Estate deceassed the daye of his deathe
the place of his buriall his Mariages & his yssues owghte
to be taken by Certificat & Recorded in the Office of thesaid
kinge of Armes for his perpetuall memorye
Bearing of differences Item no Gentillmen owght to beare theire difference in Armory
otherwise then the order of Armes requireth ./
